alert.note: Alert for Bighorn Canyon; Northeastern Yellowstone; Northern Big Horn; Pryor, Northern Bighorn Mountains; Southern Big Horn; Southwestern Yellowstone (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 01 at 8:17PM MDT by NWS Billings
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of western Big Horn and south central Yellowstone Counties through 900 PM MDT... At 815 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 14 miles northwest of Hardin to near Fort Smith. Movement was west at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail, along with very heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Localized low land flooding is possible. This storm will impact travel on Interstate 90 between Hardin and Billings. Locations impacted include... Worden, Fort Smith, Ballantine, Pompeys Pillar and Crow Indian Reservation. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.

area.areaDesc: Bighorn Canyon; Northeastern Yellowstone; Northern Big Horn; Pryor, Northern Bighorn Mountains; Southern Big Horn; Southwestern Yellowstone
